text: there's nothing that says summertime
more than grilled steak in court I've
seasoned a skirt steak with salt and
pepper and let it sit for about ten
minutes and that's ready to go on the
grill
I like skirt steak because it's got a
nice chew it's not too expensive a cut
and it grows very quickly and of course
the corn I've cut these into coins makes
it easy to pick up and bite just like
this no oil no salt no pepper just the
steak is seasoned and I'm gonna let them
blister while the steak cooks yeah I
think we'll get these all just to fit
now while that cooks let's make the
chimichurri sauce what is chimichurri
well it's a magic green sauce with equal
parts cilantro and parsley chimichurri
is a green sauce traditional to
Argentina and it's served with all kinds
of grilled meat steak chickens pork you
name it so the garlic goes into the bowl
and the herbs I have 1/2 cup each of
parsley and cilantro the herbs are so
fragrant when the knife hits them this
may seem like a lot of herbs but you
really want an abundance of this you
can't really have too much chimichurri
with your grilled steak that goes into
the bowl too and for the finishing
touches half a cup of extra-virgin olive
oil and three tablespoons of red wine
vinegar his Melvin saying we good lots
of salt and pepper be generous here it
always takes more than you think and
this just needs a quick stir you can
make the chimichurri several hours ahead
just put it in a container and pour a
thin film of olive oil over the top so
that it doesn't oxidize I think it's
time to flip that steak because he's a
quick turn oh yeah that looks awesome I
like my steak medium-rare so I'm only
gonna give these a few more minutes on
the second side and the corn is ready to
turn it's just starting to blister and
the color is turning into a deeper
yellow that's always a good indication
and this is definitely ready to come off
the grill transfer to a plate and let it
rest for a good 10 minutes before you
slice it I like the corn crisp tender
not too soft so I'm gonna pull it here
it's nicely blistered it's smelling
good and just transfer right onto the
plate with the steak they can share that
real estate together okay
this is ready to slice and serve take
the steak and slice it against the grain
so that it's obviously easy to chew
oh that's beautifully cooked nice color
a little bit of redness this is best
thinly sliced because it is a tougher
cut of meat but it's really delicious it
has wonderful flavor so I'm going to put
it on baguette first some of the
chimichurri sauce on the bottom a few
slices of steak more should make sure
you can't have too much of this stuff
you're gonna have the bread in the
bottom of this bowl when it's nearly
gone I assure you and the top goes on
and a few pieces of it's grilled corn a
handful of ingredients a few short
minutes on the grill and you have an
excellent summer dinner
